repnme.cdata!: Ivory Coast - Second Grand-Bereby Rubber Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Grand-Bereby
            Rubber Project for the Ivory Coast was successful. The
            project achieved its objectives, sustainability is likely,
            and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was
            satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, providing adequate housing and social
            amenities is the key to retaining labor and avoiding
            expensive recruitment schemes. Second, the thorough training
            of tappers and foremen is essential, insofar as having a
            major positive effect on the project's main physical
            asset, trees. Third, the timely and adequate compensation of
            dispossessed farmers is essential to ensure full
            participation of the latter in any scheme. Fourth, turning
            traditional subsistence farmers into rubber growers was
            complex, especially since most of the farmers had better
            cash incomes as fishermen and seafarers. Finally, lengthy
            bureaucratic procedures, particularly in approving the
            annual budget and processing disbursement applications, can
            unnecessarily jeopardize the smooth implementation of a project.

docna.cdata!: Ivory Coast - Second Grand-Bereby Rubber Project

repnme.cdata!: Ivory Coast - Second Grand-Bereby Rubber Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Project would be implemented over
            seven years and would aim at completing a 13,500 ha rubber
            plantation started under the first rubber project (Ln.
            938-IVC), by adding 6,500 ha to the 7,000 ha which will have
            been planted by 1978 under the first project. These areas
            would be maintained during the project period until they
            enter into production. The project would also provide for
            access roads; housing, schools, dispensaries and other
            social infrastructure for estate workers; loans and
            extension services to individual farmers who would carry out
            an outgrowers' program over 500 ha; building and
            equipment for a rubber processing factory; training and
            technical assistance for Project management.

docna.cdata!: Ivory Coast - Second Grand-Bereby Rubber Project

Ivory Coast - Second Grand-Bereby
            Rubber Project

The Second Grand-Bereby Rubber Project
            for Cote d'Ivoire will be implemented over seven years
            and would aim at completing a 13,500 ha rubber plantation
            started under the first rubber project, by adding 6,500 ha
            to the 7,000 ha which will have been planted by 1978 under
            the first project. These areas would be maintained during
            the project period until they enter into production. The
            project would also provide for access roads; housing,

            estate workers; loans and extension services to individual
            farmers who would carry out an outgrowers' program over
            500 ha; building and equipment for a rubber processing
            factory; training and technical assistance for Project management.
